dict.string:
The Weather Logging Profile generates files that allow Apple to troubleshoot issues with your device and help Apple to improve its products and services. The generated files may contain some of your personal information, including how you interact with Weather and Location Services; location data; raw coordinate data; timestamps; battery status and usage; Wi-Fi access points; motion data, including raw motion sensor data; app usage; apps’ usage of location and motion; logs of emergency calls and audio routes during the time the logging is enabled; and contents of SMS’s sent by Emergency SOS. If you install this profile, it will automatically turn the logging on, and this data will be captured when you run a system diagnostic log on this device. The data will not be sent to Apple unless you initiate a system diagnostic log and send the results. This profile will expire after 7 days.
You will be able to review the log files on your computer prior to sending them to Apple. To turn off logging on your iOS device, open Settings, tap “General,” then “VPN, DNS & Device Management,” then “Weather Logging,” and finally “Delete Profile.” To turn off logging on your MacOS device, open System Settings, click on “Privacy & Security,” then “Profiles,” then select “Weather Logging” and click on the “−” button.
By enabling this diagnostic tool and sending a copy of the generated files to Apple, you are consenting to Apple’s use of the content of such files in accordance with its privacy policy (http://www.apple.com/legal/privacy).

Increases logging to facilitate troubleshooting weather issues.
